channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Longtime Donald Trump adviser Rudy Giuliani, the former president’s campaign lawyer and two others were subpoenaed by the committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol https://t.co/zn7CTCn3qu
At-home Covid tests are now covered by insurance. Here's how it works. https://t.co/R4N39wmKE5
Pfizer’s Covid pill worked against Omicron in lab studies, a sign that it can help keep the newly infected at high risk of severe disease out of the hospital https://t.co/y8jBJaLBoF
Bobby Kotick, Activision's longtime CEO, is expected to leave after Microsoft's deal to buy the videogame maker closes, people familiar say https://t.co/bQANceWuw8

A Cincinnati government entity outbid more than a dozen investment firms to buy 194 homes in and around the city, the most aggressive response yet by local officials looking to keep tenants in their homes and private investors out of their neighborhoods https://t.co/y4oSPcBf3G
A winter storm that pummeled the eastern U.S. caused flight cancellations and power outages for thousands of homes and businesses #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/kdhi2Rb7rc https://t.co/nOxEG6Wb9T

From @WSJopinion: Omicron will give much of the population what some scientists call “superimmunity”—stronger protection against new variants and even future coronaviruses, writes Allysia Finley https://t.co/4xsiK99ww9

As soaring demand makes Covid-19 tests hard to come by, many people are skipping the tests altogether and going about their lives, unsure if they are infected or potentially exposing others https://t.co/6iErRyKSgk
Saudi Arabia courted top companies to modernize its economy, but the business environment has grown more hostile and investors are souring on the oil-rich kingdom https://t.co/lhGt7mXtRx
Some lawmakers are pushing for tighter rules on stock trading by members of Congress, citing sensitive information and possible conflicts of interest https://t.co/eiQcBdWFbs
Microsoft is nearing a deal to buy Activision Blizzard for more than $50 billion, people familiar say, in what would be its largest acquisition by far https://t.co/WUt6Yq6qRQ
One hundred times as powerful as Hubble, the James Webb telescope could show the face of Abraham Lincoln on a penny from 24 miles away https://t.co/VpPbE9AWsj
Some of the people who built the internet think it’s time for a reboot—starting with social media https://t.co/joB9y1JiVP
An NYU grad has more than $160,000 in student loans and struggles to land a job in her field. So she sells her eggs. https://t.co/D6MyQMlQkD

Businesses that don't plan for a carbon-free future risk being left behind, BlackRock CEO Larry Fink wrote in his annual letter to the CEOs of the companies in which the money manager invests https://t.co/VHH1cq4FSt
Not sure where to start with understanding cryptocurrency? This is how it works. https://t.co/ueAim9kV4e

The show goes on for Betty White’s 100th birthday celebration, despite her passing. “She’s a TV gal, as she would always say,” her executive personal assistant says. “She was tickled that people were going to buy a ticket to see her in the movie theater.” https://t.co/uYWxJqie6N
These four ski towns in Canada are as quirky as they are cool. They’re also a steal compared with ski resorts in the U.S. https://t.co/fGySkNbcxc
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view https://t.co/epkhqKoChP
Forecasters expect the smallest Florida orange crop since World War II, touching off a rally in juice futures https://t.co/5uKGGDSCur
The number of newborns in China fell for a fifth straight year to the lowest in modern Chinese history, despite Beijing’s increasing emphasis on encouraging births. https://t.co/dBRCBjh2AV

After he was expelled from Australia over his vaccination status, Novak Djokovic was met in his home country by a crowd of supporters. The tallest skyscraper in the Balkan nation displayed a giant message declaring him “the pride of Serbia.” https://t.co/fjfftFNY9k
Scientists have identified a vast cosmic bubble—1,000 light years across—around the Sun as a source of baby stars https://t.co/KAEcK5OOGV
The nation’s capital will mark Martin Luther King Jr. Day with a march for voting rights led by the late civil rights leader’s family https://t.co/r2mXRXGXCJ

“If his intention was to get less NATO close to his border, he has achieved exactly the opposite”: NATO’s chief said Putin’s actions since 2014 are why the alliance has rebuilt its forces in Europe https://t.co/kZfs7AyM0b
China’s economy expanded 8.1% last year as a pandemic-plagued world snapped up Chinese-made goods https://t.co/rHl3OcRHoJ
Omicron won’t be the omega of Covid-19 variants. But global vaccination is the key to making sure the disease becomes endemic—and a lot more manageable. https://t.co/aB0wNwSFg7
The Covid pandemic is “like a real-world evolution experiment,” says one researcher. “Can the variants beat the vaccines?” https://t.co/LwJAX7aX5F
Anthony Saleh, who oversees a growing venture-capital fund for Jeffrey Katzenberg, used to manage music and investments for the rapper Nas https://t.co/AuSt1VSfh7
Why is Putin creating a crisis with Ukraine? Because he faces increasing unrest and disapproval at home, writes Russia expert Kathryn Stoner. https://t.co/YplvkzHQgi
Tech titans wear it. So do creative types. How the turtleneck evolved from medieval underwear to a modern classic. https://t.co/zX1Ecd0zKG

As soaring demand makes Covid-19 tests hard to come by, many people are skipping the tests altogether and going about their lives, unsure if they are infected or potentially exposing others https://t.co/LWtJIJ1GxP
An NYU grad has more than $160,000 in student loans and struggles to land a job in her field. So she sells her eggs. https://t.co/RqDBv5xz4I
“Dumb money” no more: Amateur investors took markets by a storm last year. Professional money managers are paying attention. https://t.co/MH5fQijy48
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view https://t.co/xS3gS7hrWe
Novak Djokovic's deportation from Australia may be just the start of his struggles to enter major tournaments as an unvaccinated player https://t.co/kGy35bREdD
Europe’s relations with Russia are sinking to depths unprecedented in the three decades since the collapse of the Soviet Union. https://t.co/Y17DPyj39v

Yale and Georgetown are among top U.S. universities being sued for allegedly illegally colluding to limit financial aid to students, amid continuing efforts to change college admissions practices #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/D82nnazGLJ
From Bruce Springsteen to John Legend and Stevie Nicks, the value of royalty revenue from music rights is skyrocketing https://t.co/9ZIwlnoCdF
U.S. shoppers are facing empty shelves at grocery stores as the fast-spreading Omicron variant and bad weather compound supply-chain issues and labor shortages #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/CDyHeaIgdG
One hundred times as powerful as Hubble, the James Webb telescope could show the face of Abraham Lincoln on a penny from 24 miles away https://t.co/4OObDXZ5tH
Buckingham Palace is pulling out the stops to celebrate Queen Elizabeth II’s 70 years on the British throne, with a series of events and a four-day public holiday https://t.co/rvzo1kKC2P
From @WSJopinion: Biden thought he was merely appealing to his base. He might have united the rest of the country against him, writes @Peggynoonannyc https://t.co/VoXpvJva5W
Novak Djokovic faces deportation from Australia after a court upheld a decision to cancel his visa, ending the tennis star’s bid to defend his Australian Open title https://t.co/Kyz5GUPFDV
Novak Djokovic was deported from Australia after a court upheld a decision to cancel his visa, ending the tennis star’s bid to defend his Australian Open title https://t.co/7ji0iivs4B
Tonga’s main island sustained significant damage after an undersea volcano erupted and triggered a tsunami https://t.co/N6Zu0vAZhB
Novak Djokovic faces deportation from Australia after a court upheld a decision to cancel his visa, ending the tennis star’s bid to defend his Australian Open title https://t.co/Xk7sDXZ4Ey

As soaring demand makes Covid-19 tests hard to come by, many people are skipping the tests altogether and going about their lives, unsure if they are infected or potentially exposing others https://t.co/2ntTZKnLTU

India has reached an agreement to supply the Philippines with the BrahMos antiship cruise-missile system. The deal comes as New Delhi boosts defense ties with the U.S. and its allies in response to China’s expanding military muscle. https://t.co/W13B5mQRsT
All hostages held at a synagogue in Colleyville, Texas, are “out alive and safe,” according to Texas Gov. Greg Abbott https://t.co/My092Kpc7g
